item.description:
Nate Aune and Aaron VanDerlip will introduce Plone to newbies with two talks that were first presented on Sept. 20 at the Software Freedom Day.

1) Plone and Freedom by Aaron VanDerlip
A discussion about why Plone embodies the spirit of freedom, in the product as well as the community. Plone's adherence of being open to all is made clear in its strong multilingual support and strict compliance with accessibility standards. Plone's copyright and trademark are protected by a democratically elected foundation.

2) 10 Things You Probably Didn't Know About Plone by Nate Aune
An overview of features and characteristics of Plone that make it unique as a CMS, such as installation, security, drag-n-drop content import, OpenID, LiveSearch, Link checker, Ajax, Kupu, etc.

Bring your questions and we'll try to answer them as well!

Location: http://tinyurl.com/28... [googlemap]
The Betahouse entrance is the first door in the brick building and is just a couple blocks west of Mass Ave in Central Square, Cambridge, MA.
item.name: The Boston Plone September Meetup
